text:
If you are an American, especially an American student please do NOT waste your time or money investing into this bank. This bank is the biggest scam I‚Äôve ever seen in my entire life. Specifically this branch, it is the worst. I signed up with his bank through my school, and it seemed like from day one I had nothing but the worst experience. First of all, they kept giving me the wrong code to activate my account, so I was never able to access my student loans, which made me late for rent payments in both America and in France. They also kept giving me excuses and the runaround so it got to the point where I said that I didn‚Äôt even wanna keep my student loans in this bank anymore and I just wanted to wire transfer everything to my American bank account. I tried to do the wire transfer, but the most incompetent woman I‚Äôve ever met in my entire life, somehow was unable to write down the proper information for a wire transfer, so then she has the audacity to email me, ironically two minutes before the bank closes, and say that she got the information wrong and proceeded to ask me to send her a screenshot of my AMERICAN bank account information so she can ‚Äúdo the wire transfer.‚Äù Obviously, I was extremely upset because any person with a brain knows that you never do something like that, and I even called my bank in America to verify if what I thought about this being illegal and suspicious activity, they confirmed that it is suspicious and they even asked me if I was talking to a real bank teller because they said that NO bank teller that actually knows what they are doing would ever ask me to do such a thing. It got to the point where I had to report them to the embassy, as well as the school that I was attending, because they refused to hold the bank accountable for it‚Äôs actions. I wanted to close my account with the bank, but my school told me that I needed to have a French bank account open to keep my Visa, and I believed that lie, so I kept the bank account open for a few more months, but of course they gave me nothing but pure hell. In the beginning, they told me that there would be no fees for me because I‚Äôm a student and OF COURSE they lied and there WERE service fees, I also realized that they charge me higher service fees than they did some of the other students. My service fees were ‚Ç¨10 other people had ‚Ç¨8 and other people had ‚Ç¨0‚Ä¶ how are we getting different service fees when we all go to the same school and opened the exact same type of bank account at the exact same time??? They also would tell me whatever they felt like telling me, one day she said that I can only withdraw ‚Ç¨20 minimum from the ATM but then I come back a few days later and she told me that I actually can withdraw ‚Ç¨10 from the ATM. They also made it impossible for me to get my account to zero when I wanted to close it, it‚Äôs almost as if I had to sneak and get my account to zero because if they saw me wanting to withdraw all my money, they asked me ‚Äú Are you trying to close your bank account?‚Äù ‚Äú do you need to get to a zero balance?‚Äù Why do you care BNP??? What do you want me to do, go into debt with you or something? Most PROFESSIONAL banks don‚Äôt care if somebody wants to get their account to zero or close with them, if they actually have money then they‚Äôre not going to hold people‚Äôs money hostage. I can go on and on and on about the bs that this bank put me through. I almost want to sue them (alongside my school that enabled this bank‚Äôs unprofessionalism) for fraud and emotional distress. I did report them to the (redacted) and (redacted). Perhaps I‚Äôm just one report but I‚Äôm 1000% going to let every American student know that if they‚Äôve had the same problem with his bank please do not be afraid to report them to the (redacted) as well. The USA needs to know that these people are playing with their FEDERAL money.

UPDATE: they made me remove the name of the lady who completely screwed me over and almost drove me up the wall mentally. No matter, I can delete her name, but it still doesn‚Äôt erase the fact that this bank is horrible, and that NOBODY should never engage with any of its employees or anybody associated with this waste of wood. Also, I know that they are reading this review, it doesn‚Äôt matter if I erase her name from this review, I already sent her THIS BANK AND HER FULL NAME to the (redacted), when I reported the bank to them‚Ä¶so the people reading this review might not know her name, but TRUST ME, the (redacted) knows her name and that‚Äôs the ONLY people/federation who needs to know :-)
EDIT 2: once again this bank is showing how completely incompetent and narcissistic they are. They are trying to say that I acted out with one of their employees. YES that tends to happen when people are STEALING from you & lying. Also ONE argument out of 100 other respectful encounters, doesn‚Äôt make me a bad customer, it only proves that YOU‚ÄôRE a bad business. LYING SCAMMERS.
Worst bank franchise in the whole world. Go for smaller banks if you want to exlerience crystal clear service.

text: This a company that encourages incompetence by lack of accountability. The deadline given was not respected.

Firstly, the positives are that all of the services I require have been provided. I believe my money is safe and the customer service in person at the branch has been good (although warning for expats it's entirely in French).

However I have found them generally old fashioned and difficult to use and I would strongly recommend choosing a different bank if you can. The website frequently doesn't work, and I tried to set my account up online before arriving in France, and this also didn't work at all so I had to do it in person. They try to upsell you on a large amount of features which makes the process very drawn out.

When using the bank, transactions are very slow - money takes a long time to be sent, and card purchases take a very long time to show up, and have unhelpful labels, which makes budgeting difficult. The app and website are poorly designed. Most frustratingly, when I try to make payments online, several beneficiaries have been refused for no apparent reason - including setting up a direct debit to EDF! This has been quite disruptive. The 24 hour wait time to pay someone new is also frustrating.

The service is far to poor to be worth the steep fees that they charge. I would recommend going somewhere else.

If I could, I would rate it negative.
Ever since I opened the account with them, they never met their promise, not account sharing, not free card, but instead they kept charging. Then they are rude everytime you talk to them. I've been to BNP to three different cities and they were the worst. They don't honor their part and blame it all on you, we tried for housing loan and they just found one reason or other to refuse the process.

The BNP is certainly the most difficult bank to deal with.

Since opening the account it's been a bit of a hassle, but now I'm trying to close the account and it's been a nightmare.

No wonder traditional banks are losing market share to virtual banks. It's a lot of unnecessary bureaucracy.

Request to close my account:
The BNP asked me to send my request to close the account by secure message, inside my account on the website (which is presumably really ME as I'm inside the account), which I did...

Then they asked me to send THE SAME request, by dated and signed letter. OK, it cost me time and money as I don't live in France any more, international postage, I did it. =/

Then I was asked AGAIN, to send THE SAME request, by secure message, via my account on the website, and I did it again.

Now, to my surprise, a FOURTH request with a MANUSCRIPT letter sent AGAIN via the website.

It's unbelievable.
I'm trying to be patient, but it's getting difficult. Zero patience.

On top of all this delay and waiting, the monthly fee is still being debited from my account.

I'm warning potential new customers to look out before choosing this bank.

From now on, I will use every means and opportunity to warn customers and advise them never to choose this bank.

sentiment_label: pas mail mais application qui plante‚Ä¶

text:
I have never had such a bad customer service or banking experience. My total time as a customer lasted 5 weeks. Let me go summarise the story for you.
Two weeks after opening the account on a Thursday while abroad my card and online banking access is suddenly locked after trying to do a small payment, for 2 days I try to contact someone at the bank with multiple numbers I am given over the calls to their various numbers. When I actually manage to reach someone at the bank without the call dropping after 20 minutes of bad elevator music no one knows anything.
They leave 'Emergency' messages to someone who can help and should call back within 72 hours, what a great emergency response, if only this were even true. On Tuesday after calling multiple times again I manage to get someone to open access to my online banking, he explained my card was revoked the week before (that I cancelled it?) he is not sure, but it definitely cannot be reactivated. They can only send a new one within the French territory. At this point I'm already a bit shocked by the whole response, what if I only had this card, this account and since 5 days no one in this bank has cared for a second that their customer has been left without access to his balance.
With the online banking access reestablished my first thought is to transfer most of my money out, this is when I realise that although the online banking access is back the transfers page is locked, it tells me to call the bank... great.
Over the next week, with no luck reaching anyone by phone who can explain anything and having left multiple messages in the bank contact form, I decide to start officially closing the account sending dated and signed letters in case further moderation is needed. To make the rest of the story shorter the following events ensued. My direct debits are all rejected although I sent a letter to ensure they would go through (someone says I rejected the payments? they seems confused, someone will check...) My account closing is programmed for December, in 3 months when legally it should take 30 days max. Transfers stay locked for the next week and until the closing of the account. I send official documents with the legal obligations that the bank has failed in, with this 24 hours later they finally comply and transfer my balance -3.50 Euro that they keep as a transfer fee for the SEPA payment to my other national account, a real bunch of thieves considering the last 3 weeks service they provided. I'm just happy to be out.
Highly recommend you avoid this bank.
sentiment_label: My 5 weeks as a customer of BNP Paribas

No Fraud Alert System/ No Compensation
In September 2019 I was the victim of a sophisticated fraud at a bike rental terminal in London. The French crook, who asked for my help, persuaded me--assisted my a fake "help-desk" accomplice --to use my Lloyds, then HSBC and then BNP Paribas Fortis cards, all swallowed by the machine. Subsequently the French scammer recovered the cards and took money from all three accounts including the 3000 Euros monthly limits from my BNP Paribas Fortis account ( and the lower daily limit from my Lloyds and HSBC accounts). BNP Paribas Fortis systems were unable to recognise as fraudulent the nine withdrawals/debits within a very short period but the more effective HSBC fraud alert system warned me. I then phoned Brussels to block the Fortis card. Lloyds and HSBC reimbursed me in full without delay. The Belgian bank decided that, in its own judgment, I had committed "gross negligence" in not recognising the loss of my card as a potential theft,saw no obligation to compensate wholly or partially and rejected my claim out of hand. Totally self-serving, heartless and incompetent. Don't think of opening an account with BNP Paribas Fortis !
RB
sentiment_label: No Fraud Alert System/ No Compensation

STAY AWAY FROM THIS NIGHTMARE!
This bank is the worst bank even in LYON France, specifically in Victor Hugo and 39 Rue Grenette, 69002 Lyon Branch! For foreigners, students, people from all around the world! This bank is a scam! Worst customer service! They have no proper communication with their other branches/colleagues.

WORST BANK IN EUROPE! THEY SHOULD SHUT DOWN!
My experience was a nightmare! I was tossed with different bank branches of BNP just to resolve an issue (to withdraw my money since i still dont have my card yet). PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS BANK IF YOU WANT TO SAVE YOUR TIME AND MONEY.

Please save yourself the frustration and find another bank. BNP staff are completely unresponsive, their online banking needs confirmation emails and calls (which might get a reply after 1-2 weeks), and their system doesn‚Äôt talk to itself so you are continually battling to prove very basic information.

Whenever we try to do an online transfer, nothing happens for a week and we have to keep chasing BNP.

It‚Äôs a small amount to a pre-approved beneficiary.

BNP already has my mobile phone approved in your system (via letter and then entering the security code) and they don‚Äôt recognise it.

We spoke a number of times. Each time, they promised an answer in 5-30 minutes and didn‚Äôt contact me as promised and so I had to keep chasing them.

Then they made me do this extra work, sending photos of business cards, and for what? Just wasting more of my time.

This is completely unacceptable. I‚Äôve banked around the world and this is by far the most appalling experience in my life.
In Italy this bank is called BNL. It‚Äôs the worst bank I have ever had account in. They have the poorest costumer service. They should be banned in Europe.

BNP Paribas is the worst bank I have ever experienced - and I have done business with about 6 banks from the USA and in developing countries, and the poorest country in Europe.

My review echoes the same points as all the previous reviews. The bank has unbelievably high fees, like I've never seen before. The bank employees are incompetent, unhelpful, and useless. The bank and its policies are so inefficient, inept, restrictive, impracticable, and stringent that it renders basic transactions nearly impossible.

It is ridiculous: a bank that does not let you use your own money.
What is the point of a bank if it fails to do all of the basic functions? You cannot deposit money in it freely, you cannot withdraw money unless it's a tiny amount, you cannot transfer money outside of Eurozone, you cannot speak to staff (usually unavailable), you will get charged $90 per year for all this lack of service, etc, etc, etc. Examples:

1. It took 2 months to open my bank account despite having the right documentation and money.

2. Without warning or consent, they began to charge me about 90 dollars per year in 2016, without ever consulting me, without my permission. By the time I saw that they had already taken the money out, I called and email, but they refused to reimburse or resolve the problem.

3. One clueless/ incompetent/ malicious counselor relentlessly threatened that she would closed down my account because I moved out out of the country -- when BNP actually allows all people who move out to keep their account, and other BNP employees I spoke with confirmed it, and has branches specifically dedicated to people living abroad. Apparently she had no idea or missed her training, and chose to keep threatening me, which caused me much stress and anxiety and minor trauma.

4. The bank and counselor is never available. You are assigned to 1 branch only - every time I call, nobody answers.

5. They change your counselor every couple of months - In 2 years that I had the bank, I had about 5 counselors.

6. You cannot deposit money into your account: I exchanged $2,000 and the bank would not allow me to put them in my account, not even in small parts, without producing several pieces of document where the money was coming from. And if you try to deposit money in small amounts, they call you in the bank to ask where the money is coming from -- they assume that you are a terrorist unless you provide 100 pieces of evidence documents to justify YOUR OWN Money!!

7. You cannot withdraw money from it - the limit that you can withdraw is so low that it is not possible to live with it and is virtually useless. This was especially hard when I was working in foreign aid in a developing country, with cash economy, and had to beg them to increase my limit or else I wouldn't be able to survive in the country without the cash.

8. The employees are plain and simple incompetent. They were nice, but it took 2 young men to try to open my bank account (aka input my name and address into their system). One counselor was could not even locate the closest BNP branch to my address even with the map of my address and surrounding BNP banks on her computer screen.

9. It took 4 months to change my address. (This was the point when the malicious counselor also threatened to close down my account altogether because my new address was abroad). Even though BNP allows accounts for people who move abroad.

10. Everything is done through snail mail. Makes everything take weeks or months.

11. The security features are so high and overly excessive (and even involve SnailMail codes), that they prevent people from using their own accounts. This defeats the purpose of the bank. BNP Paribas needs to enter into 2018, it is still 100 years behind.

I can go on and on. I have never been so frustrated, and disappointed with a service like this ever before. Dealing with them for even the smallest inquiry became so stressful that it gave me minor trauma and great anxiety, and I still suffer from those feelings. I have seen banks in third world, developing countries that provide better service.

Please do yourself a favor and use another bank. Never ever this one.
sentiment_label: BNP Paribas: Worst Bank in the Developed World and Beyond

text: I have been a customer of this bank since last 8 years..And finally today I just decided that I am done with this terrible customer service... I am travelling and before leaving France I told them several times that could you increase my card limit and the person confirmed that . But once I out of the country it doesn't work. I even called them 3 times and someone always picked up and they told they would get back. But never returned.. just unethical people... We trust out banks and thats how they treat us.... how can a company treat their clients such..Guys please if you are non French just avoid this bank.. they are just terrible

The worst bank I have ever dealt with and by far the worst customer service from a company. I've spent 4 months trying to open a French bank account for my year abroad... I'm now halfway through the year and still do not have access to my account. I have sent countless emails to the employee in charge of my account who has not responded. Appalling customer service. Save yourself the hassle and go elsewhere!
sentiment_label: The worst bank I have ever dealt with‚Ä¶

text:
Absolutely useless and complete nonsense in terms of process.

It got easier for me to Transfer money between two international accounts from my UK bank than doing a money transfer from a BNP Paribas account to another BNP Paribas account.

They also provided me with a support number bwhich I called from abroad and an automatic message told me "this number can only be reached from outside France". Utter nonsense and the least helpful CS!!!!

Absolutely useless at most things, very hard to deal with, impossible to telephone or email and expensive to boot. I've been trying to close an account now for three months and the charges keep being taken from my account while no action is taken to close a simple account. BNP is simply years out of date with no customer service, high charges and dreadful communications. All the staff seem to take weeks off without any notice and only work 10-12 if they do turn up. Impossible to get another branch to do anything, you have to go to your own branch( I was even told to go to my own branch to change 100 euro note!).
Do youself a favour, get an free N26 online account and never give any Direct Debits to anyone, pay online by card.

Takes 3 months to change my own address on my profile. First, they change it to my SG address, when I specifically asked them to change it to the UK one. Then they put a weird combination of both addresses which did not make sense.. 15 emails later, they ask for a hardcopy? We are in the 21st century. Until now I have not been able to change my address to change my handphone number on my own account. Worst bank ever
sentiment_label: Takes 3 months to change my own address‚Ä¶

text: Unfair and INSANE high charges for everything which is hidden in the small print. When I did an internet search I also see they have been fine Billions for various things so it looks like they need to ripoff their customers to pay all the fines
sentiment_label: Unfair and INSANE high charges for‚Ä¶

text:
The way they conduct their business is irresponsible to say the least!
They are currently holding invalid address details for us, which they got wrong in the first place and now will not update to our correct address as listed on companies house for some absurd reason. So no correspondence reaches us, it goes to an unknown address which we cannot retrieve.
We have asked to have our invoices sent to us electronically which we never receive either, and each time are told they had a system error or some other pathetic excuse.
I look forward to our contract ending and being able to move forward with a reputable bank next time!

This bank and especially this branch has been the worst bank I've ever had. I'll explain you some examples: 1. They changes my personal bank consultant many many times and each time they didn't notify me. So each time I had to discover that my 'conseiller' is a new person. 2. Almost all of these 'conseillers' were necer available to respond me over phone or answer my emails on time. It looks like they have few good, motivated and dedicated conseillers that they assign them to their big rich clients and the rest, who are actually normal clients with medium to high revenue range, they assign them to junior or not-dedicated conseillers. 3. Once and only once my account passed the minus limit for a week or 2, for each rejected payments they charged me a big fee. I had all my insurances with them and I always had enough money in my account. You can judge the service when things go wrong and yes they didn't pass. 4. I had an issue with my online account and I sent hundreds of emails, many phone calls, asking for the resolution, and guess what I still have the issue after almost 2 years. 5. I have issues to transfer money online and I have asked for resolution but no answer at all. So each time I have to send money to someone I have to call and ask for the service or go to the bank, and guess what I realized that they were charging me around 4 euros each time they did this for me. 6. My visa card was expiring so I requested a new card, it arrived around 1 month after the expiry of last card, even though I had told them in advance, so imagine 1 month with no card. 7. I received a letter saying that my card is arrived to the bank and is ready for pick up, so I went the day after to the bank and they said it's not here, with no sorrow or anything!!!
All in all, I highly recommend that you don't select BNP Paribas.

BNP-Paribas bank in France invests in companies that manufacture and supply nuclear weapons.

Right now, countries that have nuclear weapons are all in the process of upgrading them. To do those upgrades, a lot of countries use private contractors. Companies like Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman or BAE Systems make key components for nuclear weapons. It‚Äôs part of the military industrial complex that Dwight D. Eisenhower warned the world about in the 1950s.

Companies want to make money. So do banks and pension funds. The difference is that banks use their client‚Äôs money to make investments, to build up a profit. That‚Äôs your money. That‚Äôs where you have power.

Banks don‚Äôt want to lose clients, so they don‚Äôt want to look bad. When we make noise about their investments in Armageddon, investments in doomsday, Banks start looking really bad. BNP-Paribas is one of those banks.

In some countries, nuclear weapons are completely illegal, but not yet in every country. Some banks, like BNP Paribas, will use this as an excuse, saying that their investments in nuclear weapon producers are okay. But they‚Äôre not. There is a moral and ethical line on what is acceptable and what is not. Nuclear weapons are unacceptable, and its time to get the banks on board. How can BNP Paribas say that it‚Äôs time to divest from tobacco and fracking, yet not be divesting from nuclear weapons?

STOP investing in nuclear weapons BNP-Paribas!
sentiment_label: BNP-Paribas: cesser d'investir dans les armes nucl√©aires!

I don¬¥t reccommend BNP Paribas, specially the Online Branch (Agence en Ligne)

I have been client of BNP Paribas since 2015 when I was still student and BNP offered special opening conditions as a business partner from my business school (Ecole de Commerce).
After moving out of Paris to another French city, I decided to join the Online branch (Agence en Ligne). Unfortunately, in the Agence en Ligne I have found the most unprofessional staff from BNP Paribas for several reasons:
- They haven¬¥t delivered in many promises both economic or just customer-service-based like call backs.
- They miss 95% of the telephone appointments (you take an appointment and they just don¬¥t call you).
- Completely unprofessional service after a problem with fraud charges in my debit card. It took 4-5 months and more than a dozen of calls to get reimbursed...
- They have change my personal advisor several times.
- They don¬¥t reply the internal messages
- They have a high-fee structure

If you are looking for a good online banking provider I recommend you to look somewhere else.

It is the worst bank who does not care about their clients. They charge some random insane fees and they do not explain why do they charge them. I had the worst experience with them - it is crazy to think that this could be international bank. Do not even think about getting their services, you would save more money by not!!!

text:
Agreed. It is the worse bank I ever encountered. 4 years with them never one time we felt service is acceptable. The consultants are arrogant, rude and lazy. To have appointment with them it takes weeks or months. When you meet them they made you feel like they are doing you a big favour by granting you an appointment. You can complain you can take it to their superior, no action.

We moved home and I was hopeful it will be better. I went to new branch to get an appointment. 3 weeks after when I turned up for the appointment a rude and arrogant woman came out "pas moi" "pas rdv". Now we keep our account really small just deposit and withdraw nothing else.

Sadly, the bank has good products but are having idiots with high ego sitting in big office and turn down customers. I suggest they do not waste money advertising for business until their staff is trained to treat customers well.

This is the worst bank ever! Don't make the mistake to open an account there! These people are the definition of obnoxious French people who refuse to speak English!I opened an account when I was living in Paris and in the 5 years I have the account I couldn't find one person to speak English. They are so, so rude and charge insane fees for no reason. The fact that all of the reviews here are so bad says a lot about them.
STAY AWAY FROM BNP PARIBAS, THE WORST! BANK EVER

text:
Have a Online bank account in France with them. Awful customer support, awful reactivity and overall really bad experience.
A real pain in the a** to actually talk to your Counselor, even though you may have called ten times or book a meeting.

I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS BANK TO ANYONE !

Worst Bank, and client service ever!
The Bank charges incredibly high fees for everything. Lost card, delivery of unsolicited mail, insurance, over draft fees and credit card fees.

Client service on the other hand is the worst I've ever experienced in my life.

France is very well known for bad customer service, but with this bank it's pushed to another level.

The account managers are completely unprofessional. Mostly not available, rarely ever respond to emails, do not speak a language other than french, and have a bad attitude that just puts you off from wanting to contact them, as you will get more frustrated and your problems will not be solved.

After being charged for years an enormous amount of unexplained fees, and I finally decided to change my bank, I am still unable to close the goddamned account with them.

I have sent the request 3 months ago, and as of this date the account is open. I am also, believe it or not, still being charged for card fees, and other fees for services I can not use, as my account is locked, every single month.

My frustration is growing and nothing is being done.

Avoid it at all costs for your own good!

BNP Paribas branch in Paris Montholon is the worst I have ever seen in 15 years of experience with banks in France. Customer service is equivalent to 0, you can not reach them, they either do not reply to email or reply with weeks of delay, they do not process request. The bank cost me a fortune and is not delivering
sentiment_label: BNP Paribas branch in Paris Montholon ‚Ä¶

text:
A bunch of idiots.
1 - They got my name wrong in the bank account and also in the debit card.
2 - They got me the wrong debit card (I signed up for a premium one and they got me a standard one).
3 - I got a second card, this time the name was right but still not premium.
4 - One day they randomly decided to block my card (?) so I needed to get a new one, AGAIN.
All of this happened in 3 months. After that, I just closed the bank account and ran away otherwise who knows what else they would have done. Just the worst service ever.
(This was in France, by the way)

My emails and letters get ignored and can't do anything (like close my account) without speaking to my adviser, who is never available. Ridiculous charges imposed too, and without warning me, simply to have a bank account (I'm not overdrawn or anything: it seems to be a French thing to charge you just for having an account, as and when and for however much they wish).

You pay 35 euros/year for a bank account where there are few branches in the country anyway, and only 1 in 10 of them have tills in that you can deposit money. Don't break your card or lose it they will keep it at the branch yu opened the account in which is often 500km away. You have to fight to get them to do anything for you.
Lazy staff that get paid to do nothing but look smart.
sentiment_label: No words can describe how bad their customer service is.
